definition: to get a better job somewhere else (idiom)/to seek alternative employment

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning

sentences.english: Why don't you find a new job or new company that will allow you to grow?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么不另谋高就以使自己得到发展呢？

sentences.english: You can either accept it, or you can find another job.
sentences.chinese: 你可以接受，或者另谋高就。

sentences.english: Perhaps I need to find a position in another department or within anotherorganization.
sentences.chinese: 或许我需要换个部门或另谋高就。

sentences.english: This created a backlog of workers waiting for better times to make a move to better jobs.
sentences.chinese: 大量员工等待更好时机以另谋高就。

sentences.english: If you don't, you are not.
sentences.chinese: 如果不知道，最好还是另谋高就。

sentences.english: He always said he would quit, so we finally called his bluff.
sentences.chinese: 他常以辞职相要挟，我们终于让他另谋高就。

sentences.english: My recommendation to him was that he start updating his résumé.
sentences.chinese: 我给他的建议是，马上更新自己的简历，另谋高就。

definition: to retire/to leave office/to quit a job
to pack and quit/to be sacked
(coll.) to quit one's job in disgust
to improve one's family's social status by moving up in the world/to switch one's allegiance to a new patron
please find sb better qualified than me (idiom)
to form one's own group or school of thought/to set up one's own business/to establish oneself
to keep an official position/to hold on to one's job
player whose turn comes next (in a game)/next one/my humble home
